column18: To the shareholders of NORDIC HOUSEWARE GROUP A/S
column23: The annual report is presented in accordance with the Danish Financial Statements Act.
column24: In our opinion, the financial statements give a true and fair view of the Entityâs financial position at 31.12.2017 and of the results of its operations  and cash flows for the financial year 01.01.2017 - 31.12.2017.
column31: Nordic Houseware Group is characterized by a dynamic knowledge environment which places great demands on the Group when it comes to collecting and disseminating information. Moreover, the individual employeeâs personal knowledge plays an important part.
column32: Current tax payable or receivable is recognised in the balance sheet, stated as tax calculated on this year's taxable income, adjusted for prepaid tax.
column33: Amortisation, depreciation and impairment losses relating to intangible assets and property, plant and equipment comprise amortisation, depreciation and impairment losses for the financial year, calculated on the basis of the residual values and useful lives of the individual assets and impairment testing as well as gains and losses from the sale of intangible assets as well as property, plant and equipment.
column34: Cash comprises cash in hand and bank deposits.
column35: Cost of sales comprises goods consumed in the financial year measured at cost, adjusted for inventory writedowns.
column36: Prepayments comprise prepaid expenses and prepaid royalty.
column37: Staff costs comprise salaries and wages as well as social security contributions, pension contributions, etc for entity staff.
column38: Other financial income comprises interest income, net capital gains on payables and transactions in foreign currencies as well as tax relief under the Danish Tax Prepayment Scheme etc. Other financial expenses comprise interest expenses and currency losses.
column39: Income from investments in group enterprises comprises the pro rata share of the individual enterprisesâ profit/loss after full elimination of internal profits or losses.
column40: Other financial liabilities are measured at amortised cost, which usually corresponds to nominal value.
column41: Other operating expenses comprise expenses for distribution, sale, marketing, administration, premises, bad debts, etc.
column42: Receivables are measured at amortised cost, usually equalling nominal value less writedowns for bad and doubtful debts.
column43: We conducted our audit in accordance with International Standards on Auditing (ISAs) and the additional requirements applicable in Denmark. Our responsibilities under those standards and requirements are further described in the Auditorâs responsibilities for the audit of the consolidated financial statements and the parent financial statements section of this auditorâs report. We are independent of the Group in accordance with the International Ethics Standards Board of Accountants' Code of Ethics for Professional Accountants (IESBA Code) and the additional requirements applicable in Denmark, and we have fulfilled our other ethical responsibilities in accordance with these requirements. We believe that the audit evidence we have obtained is sufficient and appropriate to provide a basis for our opinion.
column44: No events have occurred after the balance sheet date to this date, which would influence the evaluation of this annual report.
column46: Remuneration of management is not disclosed as there is only one person in management.
column47: In addition, the Group has short-term bank debt of DKK 65,036k consisting of factoring and overdraft facilities.
column57: The Board of Directors and the Executive Board have today considered and approved the annual report of NORDIC HOUSEWARE GROUP A/S for the financial year 01.01.2017 - 31.12.2017.
column66: We believe that the management commentary contains a fair review of the affairs and conditions referred to therein.
column90: We recommend the annual report for adoption at the Annual General Meeting.
column92: Jacob Andersen Holding ApS, 2680 SolrÃ¸d Strand.
